entry.title: TAILVAR paper is officially accepted for NAR publication!

link.title: TAILVAR paper is officially accepted for NAR publication!

entry.content:
We are excited to announce that the first paper from our lab has been officially accepted for publication in Nucleic Acids Research (NAR) ðŸŽ‰

In this study, we introduce TAILVAR, a predictive framework that substantially improves the interpretation of stop-loss variants. Unlike previous in silico models, TAILVAR explicitly incorporates the biological characteristics of C-terminal extensions, providing both enhanced predictive performance and new insights into genome-wide stop codon usage and its functional impact.

Our results highlight that features of C-terminal extensionsâ€”long overlooked in variant interpretationâ€”play a critical role in determining the functional impact of stop-loss variants. This work not only advances computational variant prediction but also deepens our understanding of protein biology beyond canonical termination.
